front.title: American National Standard Performance Specifications for Health Physics Instrumentation. Portable Instrumentation for Use in Extreme Environmental Conditions
front.abstract: ANSI N42.17C-1989 American National Standard Performance Specifications for Health Physics InstrumentationPortable Instrumentation for Use in Extreme Environmental Conditions, describes the minimum acceptable performance criteria for health physics instrumentation for use under extreme environmental conditions for monitoring ionizing radiation fields. This standard supplements the basic performance specifications for portable health physics instrumentation presented in ANSI N42.17A-1989.
